Log Into the PW EMS System as a User

Different types of users can access the PW EMS system depending on the organization and their role within an organization.

Ensure that you have the correct user credentials before logging into the PW EMS system. If you are the PW EMS system administrator, refer to the Configure Access to the PW EMS chapter for more information about setting up your organization and users.
  1. From a client device, launch a Web browser and enter the URL of the PW EMS system.
  2. Enter the user credentials assigned to you by your administrator in the sign-in dialog box:

    Field

    Description

    Username

    		 Enter the user name provided by the administrator.

    Password

    		 Enter the password provided by the administrator.
  3. Upon successful login, you are prompted to change your assigned password:

    Field

    Description
    Old User Password (Required) Re-enter the password that you used to login initially.
    New User Password Enter the new password using the following rules:
    NOTE: The following password rules are enforced by the PW EMS.
    • This new password must be different from the default password.
    • There is at least one lower case letter.
    • There is at least one upper case letter.
    • There is at least one numeric character.
    • There is at least one special character from the list: ! @ # % _ & $ ^ * ? : ; ~ = ` |
    • There is a minimum of 8 characters expected in the password.
    • There is a maximum of 16 characters expected in the password
    Confirm User Password

    Reenter the new user password to confirm it.
  4. If the password conditions are met, the Change Password button is enabled.
  5. Click Change Password.
Upon successful update and login, the password expiration is set to its configured value (120 days by default) and the Device Summary window displays.
Parent topic: Access the PW EMS
